Name: Humain_S2P_APD
Roadblocks__c:
Need to localize for Saudi legal framework (contracts).

Security/data residency → must be Saudi-hosted.

ERP integration flexibility (SAP/Oracle).

Technical documentation depth demanded by Saejong.

Procurement team capacity is limited; Abdulrahman is stretched.
Visibility_Challenges__c:
Lack of 360° supplier view (contracts, spend, risk fragmented).

No consolidated dashboard → leadership can’t track KPIs.
Marketing_Engagement__c:
Lead with Business Problem → Why Now → Why Zycus framework.

Stress local hosting, AI maturity, and no supplier fees vs Ariba/Coupa.

Acknowledge Saudi legal/localization gaps → roadmap alignment.

Secure commitment for 2-hour demo with Tanya next week.

Position Zycus as strategic partner in Vision 2030 journey.
Volume_of_Transactions_Envelopes__c: Likely high transaction load across multiple categories/sectors.  Current process largely manual, requiring digitization.
PO_vs_Invoice_Ratio__c: Not shared. Likely low PO coverage, high % of invoices off-contract (common in manual setups).
Invoice_Automation_Status__c:
Minimal / none.

Invoices handled manually; no 3-way match automation in place.
AP_Team_Size__c: Not disclosed. Likely lean team, as most processes are manual and resource-heavy.
Project_Initiation_Timeline__c:
Immediate / urgent.

Triggered by audit risk & CEO pressure.

Current focus: vendor onboarding automation as soon as possible.
Value_engineering_done_3rd_party_help__c:
None noted. Abdulrahman has been building AI procurement requirements himself.

Zycus offered to support ROI modeling & business case.
Open_to_Pro_Bono_Analysis__c: Yes. Client requested Zycus to share business case support & ROI modeling.
Preferred_System_Integrators__c: None named yet. Open to future SI for ERP integration. For now → prefer standalone modular start.
Impact_of_Current_Issues__c:
High audit risk.

Inefficient resource use (procurement team overloaded).

Slow sourcing cycles → missed savings opportunities.

Lower investor/CEO confidence if delays continue.
Measurable_KPI_Targets__c:
80% requisition adoption via Merlin Intake.

85% touchless invoice processing.

90% supplier compliance checks automated.

20–25% Maverick spend reduction.
Prep_Call_Notes__c:
Emphasize urgency: audit pressure + CEO directive.

Lead with compliance & automation benefits (quick wins).

Stress Zycus maturity in AI vs others (since 2018 vs OpenAI 2022).

Highlight no supplier fees vs Coupa/Ariba.

Position Zycus as strategic AI partner in Vision 2030 journey.
Opportunity_Info__c:
Account: PIF-backed Saudi enterprise (CEO is Chairman, Crown Prince mandate).

Main POC: Abdulrahman H. Asali – Director, Vendor Management & Strategic Sourcing.

Evaluator / Gatekeeper: Saejong Lee – VP Product.

Sponsor: CEO (direct mandate to explore Zycus).

Current Stage: Discovery & technical due diligence → next step is deep-dive demo with Tanya.
Objective_on_the_call__c:
Reconfirm scope & priorities (Vendor onboarding first, then S2C, later P2P).

Showcase Zycus strengths: Merlin GenAI, agentic sourcing, local hosting.

Address technical concerns (integration, contract ingestion, compliance).

Align on next steps → lock demo timing, agree success criteria.

Sponsor: CEO.

Champion / Business Buyer: Abdulrahman H. Asali (Director, Vendor Mgmt & Strategic Sourcing).

Gatekeeper: Saejong Lee (VP Product, technical evaluator).

Early Contact: Majid Abdulelah (Procurement).

PIF-backed Saudi enterprise (CEO is also Chairman, Crown Prince-backed).

Strategic mandate: digital transformation with AI-first focus, aligned with Vision 2030/2040.

Procurement team leading one of the first AI-driven enterprise workflows.

All positioned as happy customers to build credibility.

History_Engagement_with_the_Account__c: HUMAIN is in an advanced discovery stage, with direct CEO mandate driving urgency. Engagement has progressed from Majid → Abdulrahman (Champion) → Saejong (Technical Gatekeeper), with CEO sponsorship confirmed. The next milestone is securing the deep-dive demo with Tanya and passing security/compliance validation to unlock budget approval.

Initial contact with Majid Abdulelah (Procurement). Focused on onboarding, security, and compliance validation.

Advanced discussions with Abdulrahman (Director) + Saejong (VP Product).

CEO directly aware of Zycus → raised visibility and urgency.

Current stage: discovery + technical evaluation; awaiting security checklist and scheduling of deep-dive demo (2 hours).
Secondary_Research_on_Account__c: Drive AI adoption in procurement as a showcase for Vision 2030/2040

Highlight Merlin Intake & Agentic AI (autonomous sourcing & negotiation).

Address technical queries:

Identify_Potential_Questions_Objections_:
Does Zycus support Saudi legal frameworks in contracts?

Where will data be hosted? (KSA vs UAE vs global).

How does Zycus integrate with ERP (SAP/Oracle)?

Can AI suggest tendering methodologies (e.g., auctions)?

How scalable is the supplier onboarding automation?

Why Zycus vs Ariba, Coupa, GEP, Ivalua?

Security checklist → ISO, SOC, GDPR, Saudi standards.

ntroductions & recap of mandate (5 min).

Challenges_Goals__c:
Manual procurement → audit & compliance risks.

Supplier onboarding inefficient, prone to errors/fraud.

Lack of automation slows decision-making, creates investor red flags.

CEO’s directive: make vendor onboarding fully automated and compliant first.
Correlation_to_business_performance__c:
Reduced audit findings → stronger investor confidence.

Faster onboarding → quicker supplier availability and lower operational delays.

AI-led sourcing → direct savings on tail spend.

Automation → efficiency and scalability for $10B+ growth roadmap.

Supplier onboarding inefficient, prone to errors/fraud.

Meeting_Summary__c:
Introductory session with Abdulrahman and Saejong to align on business objectives, current challenges, and Zycus capabilities.

Dan Quinn presented Zycus Source-to-Pay suite with special focus on:

Merlin Intake (chat-driven procurement intake).

Agentic AI sourcing & negotiation workflows.

Contract risk analysis AI (third-party paper evaluation).

Saejong emphasized need for detailed technical documentation & end-to-end demo before making a recommendation to the CEO.

Abdulrahman confirmed urgency due to audit pressures and CEO mandate, positioning Zycus as a potential strategic partner.
What_are_your_current_challenges__c:
Manual vendor onboarding → audit & compliance risks.

Fragmented procurement workflows, no AI/automation.

Time-consuming sourcing & contract processes.

Poor visibility across supplier base → hard to track spend & risk.
Attempted_prior_improvements__c:
Tried ERP customizations (SAP/Oracle).

Manual workarounds; nothing scalable or AI-driven.
Target_metric_improvement__c:
Cut onboarding cycle time from weeks → <5 days.

Achieve >85% touchless invoice matching.

Reduce Maverick spend by 20%+.
Sourcing_Event_Tools__c:
Used ERP (SAP/Oracle) basic RFP modules.

Mention of UDO customization previously.

No modern AI-driven sourcing tool in place
Sourcing_Event_Frequency__c: Not explicitly mentioned. Likely moderate to high given size of org & multi-sector investments.
Current_ERP_System__c: SAP & Oracle (both mentioned; no clarity on single standard).

t disclosed, but expected multi-billion SAR.
